revised_title: Velocity-modulation Infrared Laser Spectroscopy of Molecular Anions
tldr: The article describes the development of a new laser absorption spectroscopy technique called velocity-modulation infrared laser spectroscopy, which is used to study molecular anions in electrical discharges. This technique allows for the measurement of vibration-rotation spectra of strongly bound 'classical anions' by taking advantage of the Doppler effect resulting from the net drift motion of ions in the electric field of a positive column plasma. The technique is demonstrated through the study of hydroxide and other molecular anions.
